alert.note: Alert for Grainger; Jefferson; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:26PM CST until January 12 at 12:45PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EST FOR EASTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN COCKE...EAST CENTRAL GRAINGER... EAST CENTRAL SEVIER AND HAMBLEN COUNTIES... At 126 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over White Pine, or 8 miles south of Morristown, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Newport, Dandridge, Bean Station, White Pine, Baneberry, Parrottsville, Panther Creek State Park, Bird Crossing and Bybee. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 420 and 438. Interstate 81 in Tennessee between mile markers 1 and 15. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
